info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 8 at 10:12PM EDT until June 13 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Edwardsport.
White River at Elliston.
Wabash River at Montezuma.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Petersburg.
White River at Hazleton.
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Rainfall amounts within the past few days of two to four inches across central Indiana is producing minor flooding along the White River as well as Wildcat Creek and Mississinewa River. Additional rainfall of up to an inch is possible through tomorrow night.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...From late Monday night to early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Governors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Sunday /8:30 PM CDT Sunday/ the stage was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning to a crest of 16.7 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1230 PM EDT /1130 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
